_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This document contains all required information in order to meet 40 CFR 68 "Risk Management Program". This document consists of the executive summary and registration data elements (68.155 through 68.185).

1.0    RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Helmitin, Inc. (Helmitin) has flammable gases (Propane, Butane, and Dimethyl Ether) on site that requires protection as defined under the Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation (29 CFR 1926.64).  Helmitin has implemented a PSM program to provide information to employees to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling and processing of highly hazardous materials.  The program emphasizes the application of management controls and standard operating procedures when addressing the risks associated with handling or working near highly hazardous chemicals.  This Risk Management Plan (RMP) summarizes the worst case scenarios for a release of these flammable gases, the management systems and monitoring systems in place to prevent such a release, and the training and employee participation in the PSM program.

In accordance with the 2004 amendment to the RMP regulations, the off-site consequence analyses (OCA) are not included in this executive summary.

2.0    PROCESS DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

A gas house operation charges propellants in adhesive aerosol products. The gas house operation includes the gas house, propellant storage tanks, and associated transfer equipment and piping.   The propellant is pumped from one of the three storage tanks to the filling station in the gas house.  The propellant feed rate is controlled by parameters setup in the PLC panel.  

The propellants stored in the three storage tanks are the RMP regulated substances propane, butane, and dimethyl ether.  One propellant is a mixture of propane and butane.  The other propellant is dimethyl ether.  

3.0    GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL - SPE

CIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Helmitin has developed an OSHA PSM program for the gas house operation and associated storage tanks. At Helmitin, the listed propellants used in the gas house operation fall under the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program, which is identical to the OSHA PSM program. EPA has said that if the process is in compliance with OSHA PSM, then it is compliance with RMP Program 3. Thus, PSM has been reviewed and determined to be complete for the RMP document. 

This is a new process with initial training including both classroom and on the job.

4.0    FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidents.  This is the initial RPM for a new process. 

5.0    EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN

Helmitin plans to rely on the City of Olive Branch Fire Department until an emergency response plan has been developed.

6.0    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

No safety changes are planned.  This is the initial RPM for a new process.
